9.18.17  8:18 pm   Bill, do you think that no matter what song/vid you're about to release, people are gonna say that it's not as good as your old stuff?

     saying things are "not as good as they used to be" is always a common thing to say, and there will always be people saying that. i think it's a very toxic kind of thinking, but it is always around

9.18.17  8:13 pm   i'm taking an after school ap music theory class, because i wanna major in music someday (i'm a senior in hs), but everyone in the class is leagues ahead of me and the teacher is very Not Nice. should i stick it out or find another way to learn?

     i think learning music this way will NOT be useful for you at this time in your life, and may actually permanently damage your inspiration. a 'music theory class' usually means nothing if you haven't already had a lot of experience playing around in music and figuring at least some things out for yourself before hand. otherwise the information is just not gonna make any sense at all. it would be like putting an infant in kindergarten

9.18.17  2:07 pm   I know you are not primarly a guitar player but i am, and i always hold my pick with three fingers and my teacher says i should switch to a different grip to make it easier, the thing is my grip feels really natural since ive been using it for a long time and i wanted to know if i should switch to the other to maybe improve my skills but have a tough time getting used to it or just stick to what i know and feel comfortable with?

     in this case, i think you should stay with your method. for 2 reasons, because it's comfortable, and because you've been doing it a long time. both of those reasons combined tell me that you should stay with your way. there are some situations where you might want to take expert advice (like for example if you are a beginniner or something) but in your situation i think that does not apply

9.18.17  12:58 pm   others don't complete my work. i don't care whoever is it, i never would let someone do that, it's MINE. i just tell people what to do. but to stage something there are other people i have to work with, the people who made me write the script and who will probably cut some scenes out. it seems it's my only choice right now, to work with them or anyone else who is able to cut until i'm ready to take bigger and faster steps. i actually want to do it on my own, right now and i'm still trying to figure out how to do such a thing alone (and i'm open to any suggestion from you). i think writing anything is meant to be done alone and i do it that way because it's the best one but shooting a film or performing a play... i really have to work with a crew (and with some people outside the crew) unless we are talking about an online monologue video here. so yeah i'm not completely free at the moment but one day i will be, i have just begun. what i'm saying is, i don't rely on others to complete my work, it's more like i command them. you definitely should try this. even if 'they' are the people i told you about, i'm the one who is in the driver's seat and i wouldn't write the script if i wasn't. letting them cut stuff is compromising, because i know the script i've written is risky, and daring.

     right, i agree with all of this. and i do hope to do that stuff some day. the only thing is if you really want to tell a bunch of people what to do, you need to be at a reasonably high standing in society. meaning you need to be able to pay everyone adequately, at least if you want professional quality work. and if you can't afford to pay them, you have to always worry about whether they want to keep working with you, and you will be walking on eggshells, perhaps afraid to give the kind of serious direction you might want to give. Working completely alone is a different thing. it means you can't use actors, you can't have camera operators, .... you are limited to entirely different mediums, like animation, etc. and that is very hard work. like i said, it depends on your level of difficulty in working with others. if you really really can't do it (like i can't) then it might be worth it to re-imagine your entire career around things you can do yourself. at least until you have more resources. nowadays you can get further than ever working alone

9.18.17  11:49 am   pls help bill what are the time signatures in i wanna be a movie star? i've been struggling to discover it but it's so difficult and

     the main hook/chorus is 4+5 (alternating 4, and 5.) the verse goes 4, 5, 4, 5, 3, 3, 6 (i know you may think it makes no sense to use 3's and 6's both, but that's just the way i think of it. you could break any of these up any way you want) and the second half of the first verse is the same BUT, i can't remember, there might be an extra beat at the end of the verse, so the second time around might be 7 or 6. i remember there was some discrepancy here, different ones felt like they needed to be different ways. i haven't heard it since it was released. the end of each verse might be either 6 or 7, you'll have to count yourself, i haven't heard it since it was released and i'm not listening to it now. The chorus right before the bridge is cut short, so that entire chorus would be 4, 5, 4, 5, 4, 5, 4, 3. The bridge is 6, 7, 6, 4, 7 (you could break this up in many different ways. also not totally sure about what the hang time is on the end of the bridge, i don't remember for sure) all these times are expressed in terms of quarter notes. so when i say "5" that means "5/4"

9.18.17  10:07 am   mary plays her music in headphones. bob plays his music on a speaker. mary tells bob, "please use headphones. i use them so i don't disturb you, so please use them so you don't disturb me." then bob says, "i would not be disturbed if you played your music on a speaker. i am allowing you to use a speaker, so i should be allowed to use a speaker also." what should mary do?

     get a good pair of isolation headphones. seriously, i have them and i have used them to save many afternoons
